Posts.Content: RobynK wrote: Hi all,  I was wondering for those that changed their Xeloda schedule from 14 on 7 off to 7 on and 7 off how that works.  Do you take a higher dosage moving to a 7/7 schedule?  How often do you get your blood work done?  I've been on the 14/7 schedule for a little over a year now and getting my blood checked every 3 weeks.  I've been thinking about moving to a 7/7 schedule to minimize the side effects but was curious for those that already changed schedules how it all is working for you?  Any information you could provide would be greatly appreciated. Dx 11/2009, ILC, Stage IV, 15/15 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Xeloda - going from 14/7 to 7/7 schedule RobynK penny4cats

Posts.Content: RobynK wrote: I was just dx with bone mets and my Onc is suggesting I take Aredia monthly.  Can anyone share their experience with it?  Reading the side effects are so scary :( Thanks! Dx 11/2009, ILC, Stage IV, 15/15 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone taking Aredia? RobynK Stormy1

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2009 03:30PM RobynK wrote: Thank you all for your responses.  It makes me feel a lot better about this. I was reading up on  the Aredia website that I should be taking at least a 500mg calcium supplement as well as a multi vitamin with 400 IU of vitamin D a day.  When I questioned my doc on supplements and vitamins he said not to take anything, just have a good balanced diet.  Think I'm going to go with what the Aredia website suggests.  I'm also a little concerned because my Onc said I have a slight case of anemia and I read that could be a problem with Aredia's SE's as well.  I'm also worried because I'm taking Ibuprofen for pain (3 pills/3x day) and I saw that might cause a drug reaction.  I was given acetomitophen (sp?) with codeine but that puts me to sleep.  I can't function with vicodin and I'm not sure what other options I have. What do you all take for pain?
Posts.Title: Anyone taking Aredia? RobynK Stormy1

Posts.Content: RobynK wrote: Hi Ladies,  I was just sitting here thinking tht the only time I really post any messages is when things are going bad for me or when I am dealing with "scan anxiety".  I'm a lurker for the most part.  I recently had a PET/CT scan done (3 mos after intial mets dx) and was told I had "Dramatic Improvement".  I was going to post that, when I suddenly felt guilty because I know so many of you are fighting so hard to stay above water.  I'm not dancing with NED... but I just got a twinge of guilt and was wondering if anyone else feels this way at times.  I read most of the posts and I feel as if I know some of you really well.  I just want you all to know that you are in my prayers and I hope that one day we will find a cure so that NOBODY has to go through what we do.  Thank you to those that put themselves out there for all of us 'lurkers' to learn from.  You are truly appreciated!!! Dx 11/2009, ILC, Stage IV, 15/15 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Do you ever feel guilty?? RobynK konakat

Posts.Title: I'm trying to grasp the meaning of Stage IV... RobynK KellyC

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2012 04:34PM RobynK wrote: Stella, I have come to look at this journey as a roller coaster ride.  It has it's ups and downs and twists and spins.  I have gone through AC and Taxol (first time around) then Tamoxifen, Arimidex, Aromisin, Faslodex and am now on Xeloda (Feb will be 2 yrs on that)....some things work better than others...we just don't know what works for us and for how long.  We can only hope that by the time whatever treatment we are currently on stops working, there will be another discovered or approved so we can benefit.  I have been stage 4 since 2009....initially dx in 2003 as Stage 3c...it's become a part of life for me.  We are treating it as a chronic disease.  I remember my initial reaction to being classified as stage 4.  I thought ok..this is it.  I'm supposed to get everything in order.  Well that was years ago and I'm not going any where any time soon! I too have a child and I plan to see her graduate high school in 2016! My cancer spread to the bone then to the liver and plura and lymph nodes.....I thought ok...i'm done...but NO!!  My tumor markers (CA 15-3) went from 1869 at their highest, to the lowest so far was 98.  They used to work so well for me.  They have been on the rise once again but I have to go by how I feel more than just a number.  Anyways, my last scan shows no sign of anything in my liver and everything is greatly improved.  But beware....It's only a matter of time before we come down from the high only to climb once again.  It's a helluva ride that I wish none of us had to endure, but that's how it's been for me.   I just try and "live" during those up times and do all I can do to be in the present cuz nobody knows how long any of us have....I look at it like I was given a gift to take the time to appreciate what's important to me...to nurture what I care about and not take "life" for granted!!  Best of luck to you....sending you strength and a seat belt for the ride ahead.  ((HUGS))
